bug.author: bballamudi
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
Unable to run Streamlit app. Potential incompatibility with tornado or webbrower <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug:
Tried Streamlit versions from 0.53 thorugh 0.55. Keeping tornado==5.1.1
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
It was running fine before. Can't figure out what steps led to it. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Exception in callback functools.partial(<function wrap..null_wrapper at 0x7fe5c6f200e0>) Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/bb5kb/.virtualenvs/omegaapp3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/tornado/ioloop.py", line 758, in _run_callback ret = callback() File "/home/bb5kb/.virtualenvs/omegaapp3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/tornado/stack_context.py", line 300, in null_wrapper return fn(*args, **kwargs) File "/home/bb5kb/.virtualenvs/omegaapp3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/streamlit/bootstrap.py", line 154, in maybe_open_browser util.open_browser(Report.get_url(addr)) File "/home/bb5kb/.virtualenvs/omegaapp3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/streamlit/util.py", line 99, in open_browser _open_browser_with_webbrowser(url) File "/home/bb5kb/.virtualenvs/omegaapp3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/streamlit/util.py", line 113, in _open_browser_with_webbrowser webbrowser.open(url) File "/usr/lib/python3.7/webbrowser.py", line 75, in open register_standard_browsers() File "/usr/lib/python3.7/webbrowser.py", line 530, in register_standard_browsers raw_result = subprocess.check_output(cmd, stderr=subprocess.DEVNULL) File "/usr/lib/python3.7/subprocess.py", line 411, in check_output **kwargs).stdout File "/usr/lib/python3.7/subprocess.py", line 488, in run with Popen(*popenargs, **kwargs) as process: File "/usr/lib/python3.7/subprocess.py", line 800, in init restore_signals, start_new_session) File "/usr/lib/python3.7/subprocess.py", line 1551, in _execute_child raise child_exception_type(errno_num, err_msg, err_filename) OSError: [Errno 22] Invalid argument: 'xdg-settings' <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
That is, did this use to work the way you expected in the past? yes <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.53.0 Python version: 3.7.6 Using virtualenv OS version: Win 10 Browser version: NA

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/bballamudi>@bballamudi</denchmark-link> , Are you trying to run Streamlit within Ipython Notebook? Otherwise, can you make a list of the other python libraries you're trying to use side-by-side with Streamlit? There are some known Tornado incompatibilities between Streamlit and other libraries. From your error readout I don't think that's what's going on, but I'd like to be sure anyway.

Actually, the bug looks like something to do with Python trying to use "xdg-settings" in a Windows environment, which is going to fail b/c Windows isn't an X server. Could you post the contents of your streamlit app here?

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nthmost>@nthmost</denchmark-link>
Thanks for the response. I had Pandas-profiling, plotly and regex along with streamlit. I am able to get through this issue with clean installation though. May be you can close it now? Thanks
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/bballamudi>@bballamudi</denchmark-link> OK, interesting. I wonder what the problem was? Well, thanks for returning to the issue to comment!
I'll try to post the details for reproducing it if I encounter it again which given my inexperience I likely will.
